Text:
(Thanks to the on-site survey, I managed to get a hint
for an underwear design where lines don't show.)

(If I could reference the measurements of how small
she got her underwear, I could produce them in no
time...)
Now, try it on!
It's my turn? This is so embarrassing.

What are you saying? We are one day closer to
changing the world.
If I wore them, then it's only fair that you try them.
Ugh, fine. I'll put them on!

Th-They're on...but I feel so humiliated. It's as if
I'm not wearing anything.
Ahh, it ripped!
Guess they're not so durable.

Let's change the materials! Let's use light and
sturdy banana leaves!
Leaves would be too prickly!

If it feels uncomfortable and damages our skin, then
it would be meaningless... Next!

This fabric feels rather tight. It's like a cloth for
your loins…

I feel that we can sell this as a different kind of
product... Let's make it for men.
What's this...?!

It's strong, nicely designed, and the lines don't
show... This is it! We can sell this!

All right...! The president has given the green
light!

Good work, everyone. This underwear is not only
functional, but has a nice design.

While it does show a lot of skin, we can use that
to our advantage by saying you can wear this to
feel lucky on special days.

I see, lucky underwear! I didn't think of that. We
can market it to young ladies!
Congratulations! So, what do we call it?
Hmm?

If you're gonna sell it, it should at least have
a name.
Oh, my! I forgot to think of a name!
How about "lucky underwear?"

No, that feels too secondary. We need to make it
feel more like an everyday item.
Something nice and catchy.
Something more catchy than "lucky underwear?" Hmm...
This is tough...
Nothing comes to mind... Really gotta brainstorm.

Hmm...thinking too much is bad for your health.
So, let's relax and have some tea.

Oh, it's Mitsugoshi's tea! And it's the lower-priced
line.

Oh, how nice. It's so refreshing. It's like happiness
you can drink.
It's a nice way to reward ourselves. *sip, sip*...
Whew. This tea is the best. Hmm hmm...
Hehe, seems like you are relaxed enough to sing.

Tea...song, huh. Now that I think about it, going to
a tea plantation was what made me think of this
particular underwear.
Thing...? Thong!
Huh?

The idea came from a tea girl, and it's a product
for women to feel good enough to sing on a
special day.

Let's call this underwear the Thong. The "T" comes
from "tea."
Thong, huh...?

Strange, this is the first time hearing this name,
and yet it fits...
Thong it is! Let's go with Thong!

As of today, we are calling this underwear the
Thong!

And just like that, Gamma serendipitously invents
the Thong, and not even from Shadow Wisdom, but
 on her own—Coincidentally with the same name.

Due to its function and design, the Thong became
a hot seller for women of all kinds—commoners
and aristrocrats alike.

Since Gamma had poured her heart into creating it,
she often recommends it to her customers.
